ReviewList.Text: As RandITS has provided a satisfactory synopsis I will not go there. I will say that the character development was excellent. They say half the fun is in getting there and that certainly goes for Breakers. The characters' physical journeys as well as their transitional trips from a bohemian existence to survivalists is accompanied by a constant patter of clever thoughts and dialogue. I stayed up late one night and finished it the next day. Thoroughly enjoyable!

Took me a little while to finish, but what a fantastic story! I kind of felt like I was reading The Stand (my first King novel) or one of Stephen Baxter's excellent books. Great effort that kept me surprised, intrigued and wanting more. I look forward to your next book! Thank you!

I picked this book up as a free Kindle offering. The book reads like two tales in one, it begins as an apocalyptic end-of-the-world story that turns suddenly into an alien invasion plot halfway through. I found the two main characters interesting enough that I didn't get that feeling one sometimes gets with divergent plotlines based on multiple characters, where you lose the flow of the story when the perspective switches from one character to another. The buildup to the two main characters meeting was so drawn out that it was a bit of an anticlimax when they finally joined up. I often found myself thinking, "I wouldn't have done that in that situation," which told me I was getting drawn into the plot. Often the characters themselves would later comment on a foolish decision they had made, in a way that made it believable why they had taken that action at the time. I found Walt's nihilism a bit off-putting at first, though ultimately I ended up rooting for him as the author kept throwing disasters in his path. His transformation into an action hero was a bit jarring, but I thought that the author delivered with an ending that resolved the various threads he'd set up. I also liked how the two main characters were set off each other, one seeking oblivion, the other just trying to keep himself and his wife alive.

I found this book enjoyable. There are some parts that drag on a little too long. But the story is good. The plot was interesting. I have to say it wasn't what I expected. Now, there are some editing errors. Forgotten words here and there. But not enough to ruin the story. I really got to know and feel for the characters. I felt the author did a great job of humanizing them. I'm really hooked on Walt and will most likely pick up the next, just to see what he does! It was great following his journey and seeing him evolve as a person. If you're into Sci-Fi or Post Apocalyptic stories, read this!

I wasn't sure what exactly to expect from this book.  What I didn't expect was to be sucked in from page one.  This was one of those "couldn't put it down" books for me.  I think the author stayed focused on his goals through the entire book, and it showed.  I found the plot to be tight and well-paced.  I appreciated the alternating between Walt and Raymond's points of view as well as the different ways they handled and moved forward with the disaster.  But even with the limited POV, the side characters were always well-developed and meaningful to the story.  Never did an event, action, character, or location feel gratuitous, as if it were thrown in there for no real reason.  Every bit of this book felt intentional and planned, there was obviously a great deal of thought and effort put into the story outside of the actual writing.  I've read other books that fall in a similar plotline to this one and I think this is the finest example of the basic storyline that I've read in a long time.  I'll have no hesitation purchasing and reading other works by this author.

This book was recommended to me by Amazon, as I've read a lot of post-apocalyptic "what if?" thrillers. It started out promising -incurable, indiscriminate virus mismanaged by government bureaucrats - but after a while, all of the different sub-plots started to get tedious. The main character is not particularly likable, which is certainly an interesting way to tell a story, but I found myself feeling no connection at all to him or any of the other characters.

This book was very disappointing and I couldn't finish it . I like details and character development but I don't like page fillers and that's exactly what 80% of this book is, I prefer quality over quantity so this book is definitely not for a person looking for an excellent read.

Breakers is a fantastic book. It opens with a bang and the pace never lets up, right to the end. The author paints a vivid and compelling vision of a dystopian future. Sure, it's bleak - the world is kinda ending - but liberal sprinklings of wicked humor (and artful asides on the modern world) keep things ticking along. There is also a great dose of humanity in this book. Through the eyes of various characters, we see what happens when people get pushed to extremes. To survive, people will do almost anything, but there are unexpected moments of warmth and charity too. A great book, and I'm hoping there will be a follow-up.

I was really wrapped up in this book for maybe the first 1/4 or so.  Maybe it's my fault and I didn't read the entire description of the book prior to buying it, but I bought it thinking it was an apocalyptic book about a pandemic that wiped out the majority of the planet.  The first part of the book did a great job explaining the spread of the virus/whatever and told a great story from two different parts of the country.  I immediately liked it because one part of the story had a couple choosing to "survive" in place, by defending and prepping in a house.  The other part of the story had another guy "surviving" on the move, making his way from the east coast of the USA to the west.  SPOILER ALERT:  Needless to say, the book took a massive downward fall when it is revealed that aliens infected the planet and were now "conquering" the planet.  It gets pretty far-fetched after that revelation.  Had I read that it was an alien-apocalypse I wouldn't have bought it.  If you're into that kind of thing, it's a decent read.  I won't be continuing the series beyond book 1.

It jumped around too much for me.  I didn't like anybody enough to care if they lived or died.  They only kid I did like, the main character killed for no reason anyway.  I just didn't get it.  It wasn't for me.  Too dark I guess

I am just amazed at all the good reviews this book got.  It is basically just a cheap rip-off of the Stand, with a little War of the Worlds mixed in.  I almost didn't even finish it, but I had to see if it got any better...  And it didn't.  There were several parts in the book that could have been expanded on to make the story somewhat more enjoyable, and way too much time spent describing how miserable the main character is.  It was just plain awful.

A review of 'Breakers' is  a little difficult. It's part adventure, part end-of-the-world apocalypse, part science fiction, and part urban survival guide. Ordinarily, trying to fit all those things into one story usually ends up with a disjointed mess, but this is not your ordinary saga. I won't go into details about the plot as others have done it far better I can, except to say that there are great plot twists, really well written action sequences, terrific characters, and great dialogue, but boiled down, this is a story about people...ordinary people...and how they react and cope with the unthinkable. I actually read this book a few months ago and just now re-read it and it went from being good (the first read) to DAMN good! If you read this book (and you owe it to yourself to do just that), don't skip the epilogue...it is simply beautifully written!

I liked this book - the prose is good, characters are mostly believable.  By the time I got towards the end, I knew what was coming and skimmed it.  It's got that been there done that feel to it.  It's still a good read, but if you're familiar with the genre, it's predictable.  Not sure if I'm going to pursue the series.

Almost too slow for half the book. Long time dedicated to mundane life of characters before anything happens of interest. Almost gave up. Character development was somewhat disjointed. There are some confusing narrations due to errors. However the suspense at the end was great and the story really picked up near the end.

This was an awesome read!!!!! I could not put it down till I finished it. Had me turning pages just to read what came next. If you like sci do this is the book for you. Author has well planned storyline no typos or misspelled words to muddle through. Can't wait to read the next one.. Thanks for a great book. I thoroughly enjoyed.
Kept me reading right to the end. Great characters, which didn't necessarily mean they survived! I really want to read the next books in the series!

I wasn't sure about this book when I first tried it.. Then I started reading and couldn't put it down until I turned the last page. Rocky in some areas but overall a very well done armageddon style book. The characters are really what makes this novel what it is. The characters are not some super powered or even your regular do anything kind of people. They are very human and very fallible. Which unfortunately is where it becomes rocky in places. The characters are so human that the story looses its thread every now and then and drops here and there in quality. However it is not often enough to detract from the overall quality of the book. So if you enjoy a good pandemic/space invasion/simple people become hero's without anyone else knowing.. with a lot of rich detail, (sometimes a little too rich as there was a point or two I was glad I wasn't trying to eat while reading it) full on thrill ride of a novel you will enjoy this one!

Needs an editor. The ideas are okay, but not developed. Objects were not described in a way that could lend a visual. Tons of grammar errors that were annoying and made paragraphs meaningless. Why do Sarah and Anna become totally irrational for no reason? Why are women so irrational? Why all the little life lectures and advice?
Couldn't make myself read past the first chapter. Stilted and awkward in spots.  Needed a good editor and maybe it could go somewhere.
Too crude for my taste, which is unfortunate because besides the language and crude comments it was shaping up to be a good story.
One of those books that can go either way. I just didn't enjoy the plot or characters. I will try something else by the author.

I thoroughly enjoyed this gripping and surprising book.  Got it free a week or two ago, and it did exactly what it was supposed to do--dragged me deep into the world and guaranteed my purchase of the rest of the series.  The writing is crisp, yet not by any means rushed.  I love when an author has the skill to draw out the scenes, taking their time with descriptive writing without dragging out the story needlessly, and Robertson has that skill in spades.  He is also skilled at wry humor and clever observations without being "too" clever.  An absolute gem of a story, full of surprises, intrigue, and humanity (even of the alien type).

A horrible disease kills off most of humanity. Much better done by Stephen King and others. The virus was sent by incoming alien invaders, invaders who look a lot like giant insects. Steal from Ender’s Game? The remaining humans, none of whom are presented as highly likeable, fight off the aliens. Some succeed. Some succumb. When even married couples are described as f—ing and scr—ing, and every character seems self-centered and cynical, I find myself thinking that apparently all of the people I might care about died in the plague. Thus I don’t much care what happens to the survivors. I certainly have no desire to read the rest of this trilogy. And who or what are the Breakers of the title? Robertson never says.

I love post apocalyptic fiction, but I don't like unnecessary foul language.  I can understand a word now and the, but when its repetitive the "f" word really doesn't add anything to the story unless you're a teenager writing for shock value. I deleted this one.

Was not expecting too much from this book due to it being free.  The description was fairly good so gave it a try.  I was extremely surprised at how well i took to this book.  I liked it so much that i have bought the second in the series.  i am enjoying the second one just as much and plan on buying the rest of the books in the series.  highly recommend this series to all you dooms day readers!

I would recommend to anyone who likes SciFi, futuristic type books.  It was very engaging and well-written. It kept my interest and intrigue to find out what was coming next. Looking forward to book 2.
Not typically the type of book I would choose but I did enjoy it. A little long  winded at times.

As if serviving an epidemic wasn't enough, imagine the horror of finding out that Aliens were the cause of it all.  Follow the night mare of those who have servived a world wide pandemic only to be hunted like vermin by aliens who want their world, do you give in, or fight?  Find out if humanity can be broken.

I really got in to this book. I felt that it was well written and I completely got lost in the characters. A different spin on the aliens from space to take over the planet theme that jumped out to hold my attention from the beginning. I would recommend this book highly.

I had to buy this series.  I was not disappointed.  I find that writers generally fall into one of two categories when it comes to human nature; optimists or pessimists.  Edward Robertson is no exception, however he manages to bring out the worst in people while bringing out the best in people.  I was sucked in by the first book, enthralled in the second, stayed up late to finish the third and I am working on the fourth.  So far this universe has not exhausted itself.

I'm a big fan of post apocalyptic fiction and have read quite a few books about surviving after the end of civilization. This book popped up when I was searching for zombie books, and while it wasn't exactly what I was looking for, I'm really glad I had the opportunity to read it. It was an engaging story with lots of twists and turns to keep it exciting. The characters were well fleshed out and believable. I liked that they weren't too cliche, but had depth and grew from their experiences. It was well worth my time to read and I'd strongly suggest downloading it if you like survival/sci-fi/end of the world type stories.

I waited until I had read all the series before writing my thoughts. One of the best series I have read. often i have found that a single book leaves you wanting more but a seres starts to drag. This wasnt the case with this series. Excellent. I hope there may be one or even two more books which would round this out, as I enjoyed it so much

In the beginning I decided to get this book because I thought it was about zombies. The more I got into it the better it got. Aliens. If I would've known I never  would've read this. I'm not much of an alien person. It was amazing. The way it was written, the characters were pretty good. At first a bit annoyed by Walt (one of the main characters). The more I read, the more cliff hangers there were. I couldn't put it down. Definitely worth reading.

I've now read all four in this series and have thoroughly enjoyed them all.  They have just the right balance of credibility, wit and humor I enjoy in a book.  Lots of surprises and hard to put down - even though I'm not a fan of anything with aliens.  Even though I'm predisposed against this kind of book, I really did enjoy reading the series.

I read voraciously, sometimes with streaks of apocalyptic fiction from the endless supply here at amazon. Breakers stands out among them.  Not only is it a great mashup of deadly virus and aliens, it has characters with depth, moments of hilarity in the dialogue, and some genuinely moving use of language that i rarely find in these kinds of books. The author is a talented writer and has joined my shortlist of those I will follow.  I also liked the fact that, although there are sequels, this story has a graceful closure to it. So many simply stop, perhaps attempting hamhandedly to leave the reader wanting more. I genuinely enjoyed this book and will happily buy more of Mr. Robertson's work.

To steal dialogue from a Paul Rudd movie:  Wow, just...wow!!  Mr. Robertson is one of the very best writers today and you have got to read the whole Breakers series.  The author recommends starting with the prequel he wrote recently for the series, Outcome, and I agree.  (Altho I didn't get a chance to read Outcome 'till after the 1st, Breakers, and it didn't ruin anything for me.  But if possible, do try to start with Outcome 1st.  So:  Outcome, Breakers, Melt Down, Knifepoint & Reapers.)  What fantastic storytelling, character development--there's not a 1-dimensional character in any of the books, in fact, the characters are extremely multi-dimensional and so interesting.  I couldn't turn the pages fast enough.  Highly recommended and not just for SF or post-apocalyptic fans either since the writing is so excellent.  Thank you for your art, Mr. Robertson!
Bit of a roller coaster really and disappointing.Started good, was a bit painfully slow then the Aliens , brilliant!, shame ran out of steam and poor ending.

If like me budgetary restrictions have led you to free Kindle ebooks, and you download 100's and only happen upon 10 that you truly enjoy, this book will knock your socks off! Warning: you will end up buying more of this author, but you won't mind it one bit!

The premise of the book was interesting but the storyline seemed a little jumbled at times and did not always keep my interest. A fairly easy read. Short but worth reading. Perhaps the other books in the series will have more substance

The character development is what really got me about this book. Walt, whose girlfriend died from a mysterious virus that wiped out most of the population, decides to walk from New York to LA where he intends to die. At the same time Raymond and Mia are trying to manage in an inherited house in LA.  These characters are really fleshed out as their adventure in survival is revealed.  The thinking is what would be expected of regular, everyday people in the same situation.  I found this book to be interesting and, at many times, exciting.  Thought about it last night in bed after staying up past my bedtime to finish it.  Went back to 80% this morning and reread to the end. I will be buying the sequel as soon as I post this review.

I liked this book. Just liked. It was entertaining. But perhaps I failed to care enough about these people. I think after too many people die and too many characters bite it... I'm a bit numb. Where's the desire to go on? Why live, why read further? I enjoy a good apocalypse novel. I dig the whole "end times" thing. But not without some hope. Perhaps hope lies in the next book?

The story is entertaining and I look forward to reading his other work. The writer injects originality into a genre that has become as mass appealing and formulaic as a boy band. I enjoyed the writing style.  His characters are clever. Despite the fantastic plot twist, there's a pragmatic sensibility. The writer bounces from smartass to profoundly insightful. Thanks for reworking the plots of idiotic blockbusters into a smartly entertaining story!
It was good, but I just kept expecting lines from other books I've read to appear on the next page.  It was almost but not quite the same story.  Like an almost De-je-vue.

Sufficiently compelling to entice me into purchasing the entire trilogy...the characters and social commentary are interesting enough to elevate this above the level of a typical end of the world scenario.

This was a great read! Thank you, Mr. Robertson, for writing such an exciting, believable story. When you are able to place yourself into the story and leave the real world you are in, you know you have a GREAT author. For some stories you wish there a special star--a sixth one, if there was, you would definitely get one from me! * * * * * *

Have I read parts of this plot before?  Of course.  It's an apocalyptic story and there's only so many plots you can come up with. I'm not going to try and bore you with some elitist literary review.  I appreciate every author who tries to entertain me with their writing.  I like trying authors free books because if I like their style I will pay to read more of their stories.  This book was worth the read and the story is engaging enough to keep you interested.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.
Good, quick scifi. It took an unexpected twist part way through. I haven't read simple non- technical sci-fi in quite some time.

Interesting concept, but the writing was only OK. The characters were not well defined--the two male protagonists became essentially interchangeable for me, and I never got a real clear feel for any of the women, with one exception of one who had a brief but pivotal role late in the book and was vivdly drawn. There was LOTS of suspension of disbelief required, even for a scifi book, especially toward the end. That caused my interest to wane, but I managed to finish despite rolling my eyes several times. My distinct impression was that this was not written out of a love for the story, but as a trial balloon for a screenplay. It seemed to me that the author was framing the shots for Spielberg in every transaction in the book, not really trying to write for the sake of creating a memorable written work of art. Such artifice drops me out of a story because it is disingenuous to the reader. The worst thing about the book by far was the cutesy dialog that EVERY character delivered EVERY time he/she had to say something. There was always a quip or sarcastic remark that sounded like poorly-imitated Neil Simon. This became cloying and distracting, and disappointing because I can tell the author could have done better, and made his characters more real if their dialog had been more realistic.

I liked this book it was ok. I liked that the story was written from 2 different men's perspective. But the towards the end the two men meet up and work together at the end. My only huge problem was I felt the story went on forever and not in that good way u never want it to end but in more of the is this over yet. The main character Walt and Raymond were well writen I just wish the story didn't feel like it went on forever

This book is like two novels in one!  The first half is a post-apocalypse novel about a virus killing most of the population...The second half is an alien invasion!  It's a good thing I love both stories!

Extremely well written. Read it in one sitting on my Tab, yes my butt is sore. Characters are fully developed and each scene is carefully described. Little details are woven into the narrative so you know what is going on and why. It's not The Stand but close enough to be an entertaining read. Then ending was a little simplistic but the rest of the story riveting. With a little more practice and a good agent he books will climb a lot higher on the rating chart.

I have read all 6 of the Breakers books and I have really  enjoyed them.  I really like how the author kept bringing back main characters in each of the books.  I am sure that when you get done with the first book that you will want to keep reading the rest.  Have fun.

Slow start, intriguing middle with a promise unfulfilled, and a weak ending which neglected to wrap thing up. It was a unique twist on an old subject and kept me from putting it down for a while. I was just disappointed with the non wrap up at the end.

Sci-fi or horror, it nails it.  The author brings an interesting cast of characters and doesn't mind killing  them off--one by one.  Sometimes it gets far fetched, but still made me by the $.99 set of the 1st three books to see what's next.

Well, I can think of one….. bad.  At the time of this review 352 people gave this mess five stars. Unbelievable. The book is loaded with similes that were laughable to say the least, disjointed awkward sentences, and uninteresting characters.

Following Walt's twisting character arc through the plot line is worth the free read.  Though the hybrid genre flashed early chapter promise, I felt the final delivery proved too light and predictable for sci-fi vets.

A new favorite series in my catalog of Post-Apocalyptic reads. Breakers is the story of two couples on different sides of the country who were both struggling prior to an outbreak that killed most of the planet. One couple has a guy fearing his girlfriend is cheating on him, and lies to re-earn her affection. The other couple has a guy who... well I don't remember what he did, but after the outbreak he and his partner find a way to farm and take care of themselves. I really enjoyed both storylines. The twists throughout did a great job of sustaining suspense. Robertson's writing is very strong and I loved that he focused so much on the relationships, while also adding in enough description and tone to give us a visceral sense of the world in its post-apocalyptic existence. Without spoiling anything, I'll just say he kept me eagerly consuming the story straight to the end and beyond. That you can get the first three books for $.99 is a steal. The audiobook narration is superb. Ray Chase is one of my new favorites. If there are drawbacks, the finale wasn't a knock it out of the park shot, and certain events left me caring less than I had hoped to be in the end. That said, I'm very curious to see where he takes it in book two, let alone the remaining seven books in this series.

Meet Raymond and Mia, trying to find work and hold onto their inherited house on the west coast, and Walt, struggling to hang onto his beautiful girlfriend in New York.  Normal twenty-first century humans with normal human problems. That is until a mysterious flu-like virus wipes out close to 95% of their fellow human beings. Thus begins a struggle for survival in an almost empty world where nothing new is manufactured, no government aid is available, and each survivor is left to fend for himself.  Raymond and Mia hole up in a "borrowed" mansion on a seaside cliff where they plant food crops and raise chickens in between looting forays to abandoned houses, and Walt embarks on a cross-country trek on foot across America.  Bad enough, right? (Light spoiler ahead) Then add to the mix the mother of all death stars coasting in silently from who knows where and setting up shop over Los Angeles, disgorging fighter pods of alien warriors who proceed to seek out and destroy or round up for some undisclosed reason all human survivors. Well-written story and engaging characters with a bit of a tongue-in-cheek style of dialogue. The author seems to have had fun with this book, and you will, too. Will read sequels.
I really enjoyed this book Couldn't wait to start the second one. It gets a little draggy at times, but they are worth wading through. great if you are a sifi fan.
Author tried too hard with the humorous one-liners. Fun story though. Could have been a bit shorter or had mor story line. Just too much empty dialog.
Please get yourself an editor.  Misspellings, forgotten story lines, and improper word usage, what a mess.
All the characters seemed the same to me. All smart asses. Explanations of situations droned on too long.
Not up to par with its class IMHO. Was a struggle getting through it. The plot has potential though

the storyline is good and the setup is there but I just couldn't relate to the characters.  There is something missing.  I don't see them as everyday Joe's that managed to survive the end of the world.  They are just blah.  Not likable before the world ends and they didn't get any better after the crash.  I really wanted to root for them or care if they lived or died.  But, I just couldn't.  There is no hook to pull me into the story.  It is readable and at the price I will read the 1st 3 books because I bought the bundle but truthfully I don't know if I will complete the series.  The writer has potential but sure does need an editor to catch the typos and to pull the story together.

This is an interesting read worth giving it a try. It starts off with a sickness that kills off most people. On one coast a survivor decides to head for the west coast. On the west coast survivors also learn to survive as death surrounds them. Into this then come the aliens who perhaps started the plague and came to take over. How human beings survive and then learn to fight back is the story. This is the first of an ongoing series so after reading this I do think I will go forward with the books. Is this great literature? Well it keeps your attention and does make you think but it's written in a breezy style. It's more like storytelling about a horrendous happening. A worthy effort.

Edward Robertson writes in a way that is extremely comfortable and approachable. So much so that you honest to God root for the protagonists because you feel a connection to them. You really do become emotionally entwined in the story. I gave the book 4 stars because, on occasion, he goes a little bit overboard with his colloquial way of writing. I'm also going to give him the benefit of the doubt and reserve judgement on some aspects of the book that don't seem to jive...hoping they will be flushed out more further in the series. Bottom line, however, is that we have a major talent on our hands with Edward Robertson. Bravo!
Did not really like this book. Unsure if this is truly a Zombie book:)

I enjoyed this book because of how I could easily imagine myself in the same situation.  The daily lives of some the characters at the beginning of the book are very much like my own and it was interesting to read about a situation that could very well happen at any moment (except the space alien part).  The author did a great job of keeping my interest by developing story-lines for several different characters and then bringing them together to conclude the story.

Bland, boring, dumb,  characters and story and that's being generous. Suspending disbelief is not enough to make this stinker plausable.  NYC native wimpy metro-sexual who cops a feel upon finding his girlfriend's dead body instantly transformed into Olympic class swimmer and expert sniper and wilderness survivalist. couldn't finish this.  Lots of typos and incorrect word usage.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book.  I enjoyed the various characters, the pace and even the author's willingness to let important characters die.  As realistic as expected for this genre, but not too graphic.  I will definitely be checking out other works by this author.  The book was well written and edited, which is sadly not true of far too many books I select online, so if you enjoy this genre, feel confident you will not be disappointed.

I read a lot of self-published work, looking for new, up-and-coming authors. Very, very rarely am I impressed. Maybe one in one hundred catches my attention. Breakers was that one in one hundred. Though the beginning was a little slow to start and there are the understandable typos now and then, they in no way distract from the story. I was riveted and am off to purchase the sequels. I have very high hopes for Mr. Robertson. Bravo!

This book was a good light read.  Interesting enough to hold my attention.  Negatives:  old plot - aliens invade Earth, use biological weapons, no big surprises or twists.  Main characters were interesting but seemed under developed, granted it was a short novel and there wasn't much time or space for development. Entertaining, a light read, I would like to see a second installment with more fleshed out and interesting characters.

Great book. Very well written. This writer is very talented, unlike so many young writers today. I have read the whole series so far and cant wait for the next book. This could be the next Stephen King. Characters are strong but not unbelievably so. You start out hating the main guy, but he grows a backbone after suffering loss. Have the Kindle version but plan on buying the books for my library. Yes, they were that good.

I gave Breakers five stars not because it's great literature but because it is a great end of the world novel -- and I've read more than a few. It's well written, fresh and full of twists and turns. It made a bout of insomnia pleasurable and I found myself neglecting other tasks to read it, right to the suspense-filled end. Don't miss Breakers.

I wanted to love it, tried to love it. I could not get past how long it took in some cases to just get to the point already. Although I like to have descriptions of places, people, things, etc. It was just too much for my taste. That being said I enjoyed parts of the book and believe other will too.

This author has a very good way with words, somewhat similar to Stephen King. The whole mankilling virus and end of civilisation was well done, until we got to the deus ex machina of a still functioning radio station announcing arrival of an alien mother ship. From there the story went downhill, although it had its (well told) moments. Unfortunately it just seemed to get sillier and sillier while ALL the heroes get killed, which is annoying after reading a whole book getting to know them. It was certainly worth the $0.99 I paid for it to my kindle, so I have no complaint there, I just feel that this author has great potential and sort of frittered away what began as a great read of sound and fury into much ado about nothing.

My perspective is different: I spent 25 years as a cop of one kind or another and I have been a UFO researcher for 30 years. I just finished BREAKERS and I was blown away. This is all of the questions of existence- why evil exists and takes out the innocent, explores why the Universe may not care if all of humanity disappaears, and how we carry on anyway. All of this against the backdrop of an extinction-threatening plague and aliens who don't care that this rock was ours first. The author plays action against introspection elegantly and takes a brutally honest look at how people are. He still managed to stay positive about real love between people but it was never naive or sappy. I will be ordering more work by Edward W. Robertson right away. Thank you for one great book.

The author does a great job taking you to the story world. I expected a re-hash of the Stand, but it turned out to be unique with a nice flow and believable story line. Big turn-offs for me are when a story resorts to unexplained supernatural phenomena or time travel (over-done to nauseousness) to keep reader interest. This didn't do either. I give it two thumbs up.

This book was a great read. Very entertaining and quick paced. I did not ever get bored with the story line. Others have referred to it as a rip off of The Stand and War of the Worlds, but I do not agree. Yes, it does have some themes that are common in Science Fiction- "I Am Legend" was written in 1954 and included plague. It does not, however, negate the storyline of this particular book. Very enjoyable read. I will be looking for other books by this author.
End of the world plot, with fantastic wit, depth and character development.  Wish I could give the book 10 stars.  Its only flaw - it had to end.
well worth reading. could not put it down and finished in one day. good competition for ID4. Interesting characters doomsday scenario I am looking for more from this writer!

Robertson has a great writing style - gritty realism and snappy dialogue. I loved the beginning of this story, with its alternating focus on Raymond and Walt and the subtle/dramatic onset of the Panhandler epidemic. With the onset of the aliens, however, things became a bit less clear and bit more removed from the realism I was really enjoying. For me, it is a 4 star book, but Robertson's writing is really, really good.
I found the language stilted and I didn't like it at all

Fans of Stephen King’s “The Stand” will enjoy “Breakers”.  I found there to be some similarities in the two, but not so much as to call it a copycat, but there was dome of that dejevu when reading it.  The plot is interesting and well thought out.  The characters are engaging and dynamic and there is enough action to go around.  A highly entertaining read for the post-apocalyptic and horror fans on your list!

This book was pretty good. I liked the story about deadly virus, post-apocalyptic life. Four stars are for the beginning of the book which was too slow for me. It looked like story about two losers and their miserable lives and it took few chapters since I was totally hooked with the story. Let the beginning be one or two chapters longer I would quit reading, but I'm happy I make it through.

Interesting take on post-apocalyptic life.  No zombies, which seems rare these days :).  Starts off with a disease, and follows two separate people from opposite sides of the country (well, one person and one couple) and relates their stories.  Very interesting, and I like the fact that even though this is a series, there is a definite end to this story.  I would read the sequels.

If you enjoy Stephen King's writing style you will find Edward W. Robertson's as original and thought provoking. The story line is strong criss-crossing at interesting points throughout the next two books that I have also read and thoroughly enjoyed. An amazing value as I thought the books were worth far more than was charged. A great Christmas deal. Thanks, January Bain

As an EOTWAWKI aficionado I go through Kindle books on the topic like potato chips, sometimes the whole thing in one sitting. This book was one of those. As soon as I finished book one I downloaded the remainder of the series, even if they're not quite as good, the author deserves the sales (and the proceeds) for the enjoyment he gave me for Book 1.  Thank you.

I wanted to like this book in the beginning but as it progressed I found that I did not like some of the characters. Low and behold the characters I liked were all killed off. I gave 3 stars because the story held my attention "almost" to the end. This story needed a hero and I think the wrong one was chosen. He was not heroic, just insanely suicidal.
Pretty good book...I'm not usually into syfi stuff but I did like this book.
Not a bad book enjoyable.
will continue reading this series, no doubt. great style and development

Realistic, ordinary folk who manage to survive a plague that knocks out most of humanity. Nicely done. Aha! A bunch of aliens show up to add further wrinkles and are the probable source of the aforementioned plague. Plenty of room and reasons to make a series. A little too Red Dawnish  at some parts.
I enjoyed this.  An interesting take on how our civilization ends

Robertson manages to render previously used situations fresh and entertaining.  Allow the book a few chapters to warm up, then settle in for a great ride! Just be sure to block off some time on your schedule: this is a book you won't want to set down until you reach the final page.
Good story, kept my interest. Enjoyed the various characters, and the wondering of what was going on helped keep the interest.
Awesome book, look forward to reading more in the series
Great read and it was free but author is smart since  I ended up buying the next book :)
I have just finished book 6 and now chomping at the bit for the next one. Love the characters, their development and the plot. Write on
Very exciting storyline and gets really fast paced. The suspense is well sewn in and the characters are easy to understand and relate.
A good tale, I would read this again. The author did the research need to not fall into a trap of inaccurate facts and data.
Love it! Great characters and plot. I've already started Book 2 and it's just as gripping as Book 1.
was acceptable if I did not have another book to read
Started slow, but became very interesting, enjoyed the twists.
great book.
Great Book.

I thought I was reading a book about a virus that wiped out 99% of the world's population and how the ones left were going to survive. Then it flipped into an alien invasion and that they released the plague upon us!!"it was a great read with good characters I cared about!! Can't wait to read the rest of this series.
I THOUGHT IT WAS A GREAT BOOK. WOULD LOVE TO READ THE REST OF THE SERIES. I LOVE THE VISION THAT THE AUTHOR HAS. THIS CULD SO HAPPEN ...SOMEDAY.
I enjoyed the alternating viewpoints of the story between Walt and Mia and Ray. If you enjoy post apocalyptic stories you'll enjoy this book.
A very intriguing and SURPRISING storyline! Very well written. One of those stories you hate to put down until you get it all read!
Started a little slowly, but turned out to be a good read after the initial character development. Would recommend it to those who enjoy SciFi.

Breakers is a good story involving a dystopian future after the virus outbreak, and a science fiction-alien invasion story as well. I judge these types of novels by whether or not I start to care about one or more of the characters.  Most of the characters are interesting in their own right.  A good read as they say.  Unfortunately I am rather jaded right now with the plethora of dystopian series out there so I shall take a break from the genre for now. However, if you are looking for a new series I recommend this one.
Really good reading. This book will make you lose sleep. I would recommend this book to all sci fiction readers.

I really liked the premise of this book.  I thought the writing was well done and the characterizations plausible.  I really like the twist in the middle.  Didn't see that coming which isn't usually how that goes for me.  Thank you so much for this.  I am now purchasing more of this author's work.
kept my interest from the beginning right on through to the end.  great characters.  good plot.  not too predictable.  worth reading for sure.
I keep adding more and more authors to my "watch for" list, and this one went on after a few chapters.  Good read!
A real page turner. Stayed up a lot later than I should have. Just could not put it down. Can't wait to read more by this author

Not my favorite post apocalyptic series. The story had some promise in the beginning but just didn't pan out. I didn't like the way each book was a separate story and there was a lot of repeated parts of the story in each of the books.
book started off slowly, I almost quit it then the tone of the book changed and i finally saw where things going. It's not the best but  not the worse. I plan on continuing with the series.

I'm on the fourth book of this series, and am pleasantly addicted. I even have King's new book waiting while I finish up the whole series! Intriguing, different, and every single character is not only relatable, but very likable. Raymond and Mia were sweet, lovable characters. Walt was the type of guy you hate to love. The aliens were just the right amount of creepy. The story line itself isn't drastically new, but the authors ability to create such a dynamic way of telling the story leaves you feeling as if you're right there with each character. This is an author I not only will be following, but suggesting to family and friends, also. Highly recommended!
It 'was' OK.  Excellent writing skills.  Slow start, but OK.  Then you lost me with the UFO thing, and had to hang it up.  Never finished it.  Can I have my money back?  No?  Didn't think so.  :)
this was a great read to anyone that loves sci-fi I recommend this alien tale. I really enjoyed it a lot.
This reminds me of the war of the worlds with a twist.  I plan to read the rest of the series, can't wait to see what happens next.

This story shows that very ordinary people can save the world. A fun and fast read. Also makes you think about what really matters, what skills are essential, what knowledge is critical for survival.  Looking forward to the sequels.
Interesting and entertaining, with humor throughout in the midst of tragedy. Well written with few if any grammatical mistakes.  Recommend.
I keep getting surprised with the quality of books that I have been able to get from amazon kindle. I look forward to more books from this author.
I kept reading and wondering if I was actually going to "endeavor to persevere".....glad I did.  Turned out to be a good story.

Really enjoyed this book.  The double plot was complicated and the characters were flawed enough to be unpredeictable and interesting.  I have already bought the two sequels in anticipation of what might happen next.

I enjoyed this book even tho it borrows from other scifi books and/or movies. I found myself returning to the story over and over again. If Independence Day had not already been made, this book might be done as a movie.  Good reading.

I got this in a six pack of post apocalyptic stories and before I reached the end, I had to go buy the rest of the series. My son had given a Kindle to me for Christmas so I went overboard with the 99 cent hookers. Well, this one really worked for me. I loved it.
A good read.  Interesting plot developement.  Will be reading the rest of the series as soon as I can download them.
Different than my expectation going in but enjoyable.  I will have to check out what else this author has written.
Usally I read mystery books. This one caughq my attention. I am glad it did. Ecitng and well written with great character background.
Finally a story that doesn't sound like it was written by a 14 year old!  Smartly written.  Plot moves after an early period of getting to know the characters.  Thoroughly enjoyable read.  Thanks!
I read this imaginative story in 2 days, ready for the next. A good read with a few spelling and usage mistakes.

Usually when you download the cheaper books from Kindle, you get what you pay for: recycled stories with bad editing.  Breakers showed up on my Bookhub selection and I downloaded it, expecting very little from it.  I began reading and read it every night, looking forward to my new dystopian world before sleep.  The characters are very well written and the author spares none of them.  Crap happens to the good and not-so-good.  The aliens really don't figure in until the last third of the book, and that's okay.  I just wanted to know more about what motivated them to come take our planet, and that question is not answered in this book.  I will read the rest of the series to  find out more.
Other than killing off one character that didn't work for me, the book was great. Liked it a lot lot
The story was hard , to get into at first. After the first couple of chapters things got very interesting and I could not put it down
This book is a good read, entertaining and holds your attention.  Enjoying the series and recommend it for others to purchase.

First I want to say I liked the book. I was a little dissapointed in it though, I wanted to connect to the characters and survivors more but couldn't get there. It's got a great idea but just didn't pull me in enough to want to continue on to the next book. I might read the second one in the future, but I'm still on the fence.
Lots of action and interesting appocalyptic plot. I liked the characters and the ending. I recommend this book for you.

If you love Stephen King's novel "The Stand" you will love this book!  If you loved the movie "Independence Day" you will love this book.  If you love stories about people who can think on the run, you will love this book!  I  actually chose it on a whim, and loved every minute of reading, finding I couldn't put it down, and even took it along when I walked the dog.  It is a good tale of love and loss and survival, leaving the reader at the end with the feeling of hope, and of the goodness of mankind.
This was a really fresh take on an end of the world plot. It may be survival of the fittest in almost every end of the world story line, but this one has a different take I found enjoyable.
I was prepared for a soap opera and was pleasantly surprised to find well drawn characters and a plot that hangs together nicely. It will be interesting to see how the next book develops.
Not nearly as predictable as so much sci-fi. Good story, likable charcters, mostly. An enjoyable end of the world read for a summer day on the beach.
Great story. It's definately worth the price. I think the author is worth a chance and 5 stars. I believe I will go start reading the sequel now.
Great book couldn't put it down. Nice spin on the apocolypse without the zombies. Very well written and proof read

Refreshing perspective and a surprising angle on this science fiction novel.  Looking at the cover I thought the novel was about time or space travel; but I got pleasantly surprised by the development.

I am an avid reader, and I have always bought books by well known authors (Koontz, Patterson, Clark, King). I have always had the idea that if you want to read a well written, interesting book, you're going to have to pay top dollar for it. Book 1 of this series was free, and it is one of the best books I have read recently. Usually, the free Kindle books are corny, or not written as well as other books, but this one was a pleasant exception. I plan on purchasing the other books in the series to read soon.

A new take on alien invasions.  How do you survive a new pandemic, then survive the arrival of the beings that caused it. The characters are engaging and the plot well written. Although a part of a series, it can stand alone as well. Worth your time. It was hard to put down.
Characters actually behave somewhat reasonably - no obvious Gary Stu.  Would be better if the twist wasn't included in the book summary.

I was pleasantly surprised by this book.  It is an interesting twist on alien invasion vaguely reminiscent of war of the worlds.  The main two characters are well-developed and represent a basic psychological study of how people are motivated and react to devastating loss and life-threatening situations.  This is a fast-paced, well-written story, that provides a study of human nature through a variety of character types, and how each type responds to stressful situations.  For readers interested in only a fast-paced, action-packed sci-fi story, this book delivers that as well.

The first part was a bit slow, but in hindsight it was important to understanding the characters and their eventual transformation. There were lots of surprises and twists. Do yourself a favor, and do not ready any of the summaries or story synopsis. Buy it, and enjoy the ride.
this is a good book. I would recommend it!! I also bought the second book but havent started it yet, but plan to tonite.

The beginning of this book suggested something very like "The Stand" (Stephen King), but without the semi-religious plot line of good versus evil.  It morphed into an alien invasion, becoming more like Red Dawn.  The problem was the very lethargic plot development and unappealing main characters.  It made for a slow read, despite an interesting conclusion to this first installment of a series.

I was hesitant to read this since the reviews were not overwhelmingly good.  So very glad I did.  Some folks wrote that the characters were flat, undeveloped, and boring.  Were they reading the same book I did?  I read perhaps 3-4 books a week and this is by far one of the better ones I have encountered in months.  I admit I did an actual double take about halfway through when the ship showed up in the sky and the story went from a survival tale to an alien invasion but was rewarded with a smooth transition and even further character growth.  Walt is one of the better characters I've read in some time and I look forward to reading more of Mr. Robertson's work.

I read a lot of "humans vs. aliens" stories and many of them are long on action and short on character development. Not the case here. It's not an action story but it is post-apocalyptic science fiction and some really horrific events occur. Yet, since you're in the heads of the main characters from the get go, the focus quickly shifts from these events to how the characters respond and adapt. At least, it was this way for me.

A flu like virus wipes out 98% of earths inhabitants! where did it come from? No one knows until a mothership shows up and the few survivors start being imprisoned or just outright killed by some very weird looking aliens. Finally one man who had walked across the United States decided he was either going to stop the madness or die trying. Can he do the impossible and sneak a bomb into the hovering mothership? Sorry you will have to read to find out. Kind of slow in many areas but does end well. Not my favorite book from Edward Robertson but it is okay.
Believable story line that kept me very interested and involved with the characters throughout the entire book.  Already on to Book 2 and loving it!!!!
interesting book sometimes hard to follow sometimes a little bit out there but I'm not much of a sci fi reader

I liked the book, it kept me reading until I finished.  It was a little different twist to other science fiction stories, so found that to be refreshing and interest  holding until the end.  Then immediately went on to the next book in this series, which I have not finished at this time

The book takes a while to develop the  irresolute characters of the protagonists who through the course of the story discover strength and resolve within themselves they never suspected they had.  The beginning phase of the story does not give a hint of  what is to follow.  I will stop here lest I give the plot away.
Unexpected twists. I thoroughly enjoyed this book. As a born survivalist, not much was missed, and nothing was incorrect. Bravo!

Didn't really know what to expect when I got this book.  I was very pleased with what I read.  Has a twist I didn't expect.  Very good story and very well written.  Looking forward to t the next book by this author.
i loved the two coast story and the relationships of Raymond and Walt and their girlfriends!  I will recommend to my friends!

The interlocked stories that began this novel about the apocalypse began rather slow in pacing although the characters were singularly unique. After a while, the stories gain momentum and the reading is pleasurable. I was a little put off by the insertion of aliens as the cause of the plague. Nonetheless, the stories stand on their own. I liked this book enough to continue on. --Gand

very solid look at a viral breakdown and post-apocalyptic scenario.  Good characterisation, and sufficient depth to make the characters appealing.  plot and pace deliveryexcellent. perhaps a little heavy with the personal philosophy, and I am not sure where book 2 is going to go, but I recommend highly for a quick "end of the world" Read.

Exciting, good, thought out with precision. The story line sounds believable, the people are everyday persons who rise up to defend our world. Read this in one setting and am looking forward to the next readings of Mr Robertson's books.
Really engrossing story. Such a unique take on a "War of the Worlds" type story. Great characterization. I loved the two family storyline concept. Just a great book.

The beginning was great and the end was good too.  However, I didn't like that nearly every single character was so darn sarcastic that you always had the awareness that you were reading a book from an author who doesn't seem to be able to vocalize beyond his own inner voice.  Nonetheless, while the characters did blend together because of this, they still had enough personality in their actions to distinguish them in the story.  In the end, I'll be reading book 2 and perhaps the rest.  :)

Probably the best dystopia I have ever read, and I've been reading them for the past 67 years.  The characters are varied, believable and flawed to some degree (i.e.: human).  The catastrophes are both startling and precisely detailed.

Have just completed the first 4 books in the series, all within a week!  Could not stop reading!  Characters are all so interesting and real and the whole story about trying to survive and stay alive after most of mankind is wiped out by a virus! Wow. Highly recommend the series. Just purchased book 5, Cut Off, and can't wait to start reading it, but a little sad that there are no more in the Series after it!

At first I was bored and I thought Walt was a wuss.  He didn't seem to have a backbone and was his own pity party.  But somewhere along the way Walt became beyond awesome.  I ended up loving him and couldn't wait to see what he'd come up with next.  The other characters were great, as well, but (SPOILER ALERT!!) but they were gone too soon.  Half the time I was shocked when another character bit the dust, but it was a war, and it was never for the shock effect - it was more sad, more mournful.  I ready all three books and I enjoyed everyone of them.  Each had their characters you come to love, to enjoy, but I think Walt could have had his own stand alone book!

Enjoyable read.  Mr. Robertson takes a tired topic (end of the world) and gives a new twist.  Spends a lot of time on character development of two very different protagonists.  Enjoyed the slow trip through EOTW and then the carpet gets yanked with a plot twist.  Very enjoyable and would recommend for those looking for a little different yet finely written take on a disaster situation.

It was a pleasure to read a book that the author took the time to have someone proof read before publishing. The book started a little slow while the author developed his characters, but on the positive side, you really get to know them. The author has a good imagination and spins an entertaining story.

I was engaged with the writing and the characters - there was detail but it supported the story line rather than gratuitously adding words like a high school assignment - a few good twists that were no expected

I enjoyed this story a great deal. It was well written and the characters were engaging. I particularly liked watching Walt as he grew throughout the story. It was slow moving  in places with quite detailed descriptions. They were well done, but I admit I skimmed over them to get back to the action.  I will most likely try another in the series.

Breakers was an easy, fun, fast read. I appreciated the fact that the characters were just "folks", not conveniently surviving geniuses, politicians, rocket scientists or naturalists. I'd like to imagine the people in the book would be the type who survive, and while imperfect they figure it out as they go. Looking forward to the next book.

Wow, did not expect the twists and turns this book took.  I really enjoyed the characters and how they developed as the story weaved to its huge and very cool ending.  I plan on checking out the next book in the series!

A thoroughly entertaining non-zombie apocalypse story.  Smart, witty writing, some real insight into the human condition looking at love, relationships and the every day things that make us happy, sad, frightened, brave, defeated and just plain annoyed.  I was almost disappointed with the story twist towards the middle because I enjoyed all the detail following Mia & Raymond and Walt,  but the book took off faster than a hot air balloon from then on.  I lost sleep reading it because i wanted to know what happened next,  now I'm sad it's done.  On to the sequels....

This was a well written apocalyptic story with believable characters, so descriptave you feel like you know them personally. I enjoyed the read so well, I will continue on with the series. The only negative comment I feel I have to give, is that Mr. Robertson goes into so much detail that at times I lost some interest in it till it picked up again. Other than that, I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I might have rated this 4.5 if it was possible. I enjoyed the concept of the story, but I felt it drag in parts. The author kept enough twists to keep you guessing. I unhappy with the death of one certain character. I mean really. That said it is a good read and I will most likely read the next one in the series.

Really four books in one, first the plague, then what some people did to survive AFTER the plague.  Then the aliens, and finally how they survived the aliens.  I liked it, maybe it took a few liberties with the science, but so what, a good time, and a fun book.
So much fun. Well written well thought out. Great characters. Just the kind of sci-fi/apocalypse stuff I really enjoy. Buying the next one right now!

A5 rating for the story, I like the way the story line moves and the twist in it now and then. I enjoyed the way the author keeps the characters and the story line real. A book to be enjoyed by most people. I will look for the next in line.
Distinctly different type of book. I'm excited to read the next book in the series discovering how humanity survived  and regrouped.
Cant wait for the next one. End of world survivor stories are the greatest! Written with detailed precision. More please!

I downloaded this because it was free, and am glad I did. It's an interesting idea, and well executed - not to mention entertaining. I definitely am going to check out the next one (even though it costs money). ;-)
Good book but it simplified to many parts of the story. So much more could have been done with the book.

Believable story line......wait, did I say believable?  End of the world, a few lone survivors, then aliens?  Sounds ridiculous, but it works!  I was totally mesmerized by each of the characters, their failings and their successes.  Fresh with graphic details, I felt like I was there.  More please.
Good story telling s a twist U don't expect.  Really liked views of New York and getting out of the place

a friend read this book and told me about it.  i read Breakers in 2 days because it's that good.  it's been a while since i read a book that made me not want to put it down!  i can't wait to start book 2!

I got a fast paced, totally entertaining apocalyptic sory eith complexity and characterizations filled out enough that you could actually like or dislike the person. The only negative was that my imagination never could create an alien that fidnt remind slightly of a character in a certain cartoon with a pineapple under the sea.  I'll have to work harder on that as I read the sequels.

Robertson's descriptions are so clear that you feel like you are seeing the events unfold. His characters are the kind you remember long after you finish the book. This book is also thought provoking and makes you think about how quickly things can fall apart. It's also a great reminder to live and love fully whenever you can.
Was a little predictable plot line for most of the book and a couple of times I nearly stopped and gave up, but the ending is pretty good and the characters end up redeeming themselves.

I have read this first book only ...so far. As i was reading i thought maybe it will be a little Swan Song or The Stand. It's different though, not a bad different. It was a good book, i am deciding if i want to read the other 2 since i think they go onto other people(?) No matter what ...a sci fi/apocalyptic fan should be happy w/this book, it's a fast and fun read. It gave me a surprise.
Enjoyed this book immensely. Good story with a great cast of characters who are fallibly human. Looking forward to the sequels.

Would you survive the end of the world? An end brought on by a supervirus? It is not so far fetched an idea since we already have "antibiotic resistance super bugs". But who or what is the creator of THIS supervirus? Definitely a must-read story.
It may seem like a well worn idea, but Mr Robertson writes in a fresh fast-paced and interesting fashion. I enjoyed this book, and will seek out the next in the series.
A good read. A dark and stark story about people you get. To know ok w well enough to miss.

Good characters, good description, some pretty fair action sequences, but our aliens are an odd combination of smart and stupid.  They plan clever traps in human defensive installations but do not protect their mother ship from aerial attack.  Good, not great.
I loved this, believable characters and great storyline, I look forward to reading more. First  book from this author I have read.

I have read a lot of "end of the world as we know it" books and this is one of the best.  This is one of those stories that keeps you reading late into the nite .  Good job.  I bought the rest of the books in the series.

Usually I read zombie apocalypse novels, however, they have become redundant so I decided to try something new. I am glad I tried this. It was a good book and I liked the characters. It definitely kept my attention. I'm not sure yet if I will read more books from this series, but this book is definitely worth reading.
By the time I did, I was too hooked to stop reading it. Great plot twists and turns with lots of moral dilemmas to consider. Now I have to read the sequels to find out what happens next.
This is no hearts and flowers, happy ending lighthearted read, but rather a story that could, maybe, happen... Someday... Chilling and grim.
I especially liked this book because even though it was part of a series it seemed to finish the story.

These books take a familiar premise and run with it. Good character development, good descriptions, good pacing. The books deal with the apocalypse itself and then the aftermath in a surprisingly realistic and engaging way. Definitely worth reading.

i like this book because it's well written and adited - so few are nowadays. (i'm 81). The story is even believable to a point, which is amazing for pure fantasy. i usually read two or three books at the time (not simultaneously of course but this one fascinated me enough to stick to it until finished. Looking forward to the sequels.

I read for entertainment and information. These books have both. There is a dual story going on and each chapter ends with a good hook to keep you reading. Aside from the sci-fi alien aspect, the series is believable. The series paints a good picture of a world after a catastrophic pandemic event: the good, the bad, and the ugly. Preppers should love this series of books. Lots of practical insight and applications in a shtf or wrol event.

Almost didn't get this book because from the descriptors it sounded lame. In fact it was quite well written with good plot twists that weren't glaringly obvious. A little heavier on the f-bomb (both as a figure of speech and as a verb) than I really needed, but overall it was quite good and I am very likely to get the sequel.

After reading some of the negative reviews on here, I find that a lot of them have valid points. There is a lot of back story interspersed throughout. Some of the characters are unlikeable, but I don't have to like a character to find him/her interesting. There was a lot of description, but I enjoyed it. At times the dialogue was a bit Hollywood. I liked the playful banter between Mia and her husband; didn't care so much for the perpetual snarkiness that abounded elsewhere. The book did have a Stephen King feel with its similarity to The Stand in regard to the killer virus, but I thought it was quite a different story than that told by King. I think part of the reason I liked this book so much might be because I liked The Stand so much. I don't know about typos because I listened to most of the book on my Kindle. In listening, it seemed to move smoothly and came across as a well-written book. There definitely were a few spots where I had to back up and listen again to clear up some confusion. And parts of the story strained credibility, but it is fiction, after all. The way that supposedly main characters got killed off reminded me a bit of The Walking Dead. Author Edward W. Robertson starts slow in his novel "Breakers," which chronicles the incubation and fallout of a runaway virus that kills nearly everybody it infects. He spins the tale through two main characters, Walt in New York City and Raymond in Southern California. Both are twenty-somethings who aren't the most successful, intent on plugging away at life despite the seeming urge to surf the couch most of the day. Then change begins. In a way, the arrival of the virus that kills indiscriminately offers both characters a way out of their boring existence. Raymond gets a job mostly because he's "clean" helping a shady character, and Walt has to deal with the fact that his jerk girlfriend is dead and he must get on with life. Walt takes a bit of convincing, but his storyline definitely is the more interesting. Raymond acts like an observer who's forced to participate. His wife, Mia, is a bit under-used but is a more dynamic character. And dynamic is what they need. Nobody who sits around moping about the situation does well in this situation. The economy tanks, services shut down and chaos descends. And then the fun begins. Robertson injects first person observation of his choice of locations. I can tell he's lived in New York from the descriptions of sights and smells. Likewise, he's spent some time on the coast in SoCal. But he has a talent for adventure yarns. The pace of this book picks up about a quarter of the way through and doesn't ease up. It's really not an apocalyptic survival tale. The story has more going on than that, elevating it to a bright up and comer in the sci-fi genre.

This was an execllent book.  I liked how the author had two different subjects with the same theme that really kept things interesting.
This is an ok book with a couple of main characters that are not to bad.  It took me a little while to finish and had a couple of slow spots but some really fast parts to.

Breakers gripped me from the beginning. I loved the pace, language and style of the first chapter, got a little worried about trite predictability when I got to the second, but fell fully into the double helix of these stories from there.

I was really surprised by this story. I didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I did. Solid premise, amazing characters, and tremendous pacing. I will make every effort to read more from this author!

The characters seem so light hearted about most of the tragic events that happen to them. I didn't see the true emotion or grief of what had befallen most of them. Overall, it wasn't a bad story.

This was a very enjoyable book. The story begins with a flu-like plague that decimates the earth's population, and this is followed-up with an invasion by aliens who had unleashed the disease in order to destroy our ability to defend ourselves. I liked that the story concentrates on two main characters, one in L.A. and one in New York, although they eventually meet up. It's easier to get to know them, follow their adventures and develop sympathy for their losses than if the book took a wide-ranging view of the invasion. We don't know much about the aliens, which are described as giant crab-like creatures who may or may not be collecting humans to eat them. One of the few weak aspects of the story is that the aliens and their technology is too easy to resist, especially by a handful of survivors that, while smart and resourceful, aren't drawn as scientific or military experts. Despite that, over-all the book is well-written and the story moves forward without dragging through any long, descriptive passages. Although an alien invasion isn't exactly an original topic for a book, this one manages to be entertaining and leaves the reader eager to read on in the series.
